I recently had my own first really difficult clients. At the beginning, they were open to anything. After I submitted a few options, they decided they wanted this really ugly sketch of a triangle and several mismatched fonts inside it. Here are my initial designs (the clients were Alaskan, by the way):   
 ![1](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017115900im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/4100/14619.jpg)

 ![2](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017115900im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/4100/14620.gif)

Well. I'll join this party. The logos I'm about to show you ... well, the client was great. He's an endodontist that managed to find excuses to go golfing all of the time. He had a good sense of humor and realized that what he does for a living scares some people to death. We went through many wild rounds of ideas. These I think are the best.   
   
First. He showed me the negative of one of the roots. They file them in separate sleeves with information. That is from whence came this concept:   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017115900im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/4100/14613.gif)   
   
And then there was the "old-time" dentist, but a little on the morbid side:   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017115900im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/4100/14614.gif)   
   
But in the end...after the family had there vote :wink: the only thing that seemed to stay constant was Perpetua.   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017115900im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/4100/14615.gif)

Yes. The fear that is put into all designer's is that the family will get involved. However, it is a reality. I make a point of always talking very openly about who will be involved in the decision making from the beginning. I ask about there likes and dislikes. We discuss why this is good or bad. Etc. Being open from the beginning helps everyone. Even with bigger companies. Granted I'm not sure it works that way with corporations, but I'm sure within the larger realmn (so to speak) you still have an equivalent with which you have to deal.   
   
BJ, the sans is Cholla. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017115900im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)
